title: PREVIEW: Nazareth, The Brook, Southampton
text:
0 comments 
FOLLOWING summer festival success across Europe with new front man Carl Sentence, Nazareth hit the road around the UK this autumn. 
At their peak, Nazareth were huge, selling vast quantities of albums and hit singles, pulling in enormous crowds to their shows all over the world. 
They formed in Dunfermline, Scotland, and played the Scottish clubs throughout the 1960â€™s in their original incarnation as the Shadettes. The name change to Nazareth came in 1970 and in 1971 the band moved to London to start what was to become a long and illustrious recording career. 
Even with the passage of time and line-up changes, Nazareth are routinely hailed as that rare thing - pioneers who became legends in their own lifetimes. 
2015 sees them back on the road featuring new singer Carl Sentance (Don Airey (Deep Purple) & Friends, Geezer Butler (Black Sabbath), Krokus, Tokyo Blade and Persian Risk), standing proudly alongside founder member Pete Agnew (bass) and long time band members Jimmy Murrison (guitars) and Lee Agnew (drums). Share article 
Nazareth open their autumn tour at The Brook on Thursday.
